narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course has allowed me to continue working on my wet lab research. Furthermore, this course has allowed me the opportunity to work closely with my mentor on publishing a review paper, as well as submit and present an abstract at this year's BMES CMBE conference.
biology research
I learned how to research in a lab setting.
Lab skills
learned more about writing grant proposals in this class
Experience working in a research lab, learning how to write a research and grant proposal
I gained fundamental laboratory research skills and practiced conducting evidence-based problem solving strategies to support a research hypothesis in MCDB.
A really good introduction into research
Independent research
Basic research in a lab

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There was very little structure and guidance to the course. I received no feedback from my assignments.
Its independent research. Depends on the lab.

The major weakness of the MCDB thesis is that nothing is standardized. There are many people who have very lenient PIs and who are able to put in less than 10 hours a week with the guarantee that they will still get an A. By contrast, there are PIs who ask you to come in more than 10 hours a week, but then will still be very harsh with the grading. It's really unfortunate, because it means that your entire experience and grade is determined by your PI, rather than there being any semblance of a standardized metric to reach. I highly recommend that the course create a rubric for grading in the spring semester, because as it stands, the system is highly unfair, and the grades will not reflect the work that students have put in. There must be greater standardization in the MCDB thesis process.
there could be more guidance about the proposals from the instructors of the course

Course is very independent, there are no meeting times or much interaction with course professors. I would suggest having a good relationship with the research mentor you planning on working with (as well as your PI)

Strengths  feasible workload (but this obviously depends on your lab and relationship with your PI and project). 

Weaknesses  little structured opportunities for feedback earlier in the semester in addition to feedback on the grant proposal at the end of the semester.
I think it enables a lot of independence in research and gives great preparation into a research career, very practical and hands on
may be valuable to add some courses/lectures on presenting research?
